## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineschedstrategy">MachineSchedStrategy</a> implementation for PowerPC pre RA scheduling.

<SectionDefinition>

## Protected Member Functions

### tryCandidate() {#a4b73638109c4ea048c148a781996272d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCPreRASchedStrategy::tryCandidate (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; Cand, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; TryCand, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/schedboundary">SchedBoundary</a> &#42; Zone) const</>}
  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
Apply a set of heuristics to a new candidate.

Heuristics are currently hierarchical. This may be more efficient than a graduated cost model because we don&#39;t need to evaluate all aspects of the model for each node in the queue. But it&#39;s really done to make the heuristics easier to debug and statistically analyze.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Cand">provides the policy and current best candidate.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="TryCand">refers to the next <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> candidate, otherwise uninitialized.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Zone">describes the scheduled zone that we are extending, or nullptr if Cand is from a different zone than TryCand.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
<code>true</code> if TryCand is better than Cand (Reason is NOT NoCand)
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcmachinescheduler-h/#l00026">26</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcmachinescheduler-h">PPCMachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcmachinescheduler-cpp/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcmachinescheduler-cpp">PPCMachineScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
